config.question: The main difference between the peripheral slowing hypothesis and the generalized slowing hypothesis is the role of the ________ in the lengthening of reaction time as people age.

answer_2.response: Consider this: The peripheral slowing hypothesis says that the peripheral nervous system (nerves from the brain and spinal cord to the extremities) becomes less efficient with age, while the generalized slowing hypothesis says that processing in all parts of the nervous system, including the brain, is less efficient. LO 9.5 How long can people expect to live and what are the major causes of death?
